subject: Sales
title: Structure: Problem, Solution, Proof
description: A quick win: understand Structure: Problem, Solution, Proof.

hook.text: Every winning pitch follows the same invisible skeleton: a problem, a solution, and proof it works.

buildup.text: Structure gives a pitch its backbone. Without it, even brilliant ideas feel scattered and confusing.

discovery.text: Start with a problem the audience feels. Present your solution. Then prove it with data or a story.

twist.text: Reversing the order kills impact. Leading with your solution before establishing pain creates apathy.

climax.text: Master this three-act structure and you can pitch anything to anyone in any time frame confidently.

punchline.text: Problem first. Solution second. Proof last. Always.

quiz.question: What is the correct order for a pitch structure?
